description_txt: stated on May 11, 2010 in a speech on the Senate floor:
quote_txt: On Sandra Day O'Connor: "I think one reason she was a good judge is she had no judicial experience" before she joined the Supreme Court.

description_txt: stated on May 9, 2010 in a roundtable segment on ABC's This Week:
quote_txt: Greece "has a GDP the size of the Dallas-Fort Worth Metroplex."

description_txt: stated on May 10, 2010 in a news release:
quote_txt: On the importance of judicial experience for Supreme Court nominees.

description_txt: stated on May 6, 2010 in a press conference:
quote_txt: The president can "authorize the killing of a U.S. citizen who fights for a foreign terrorist organization."

description_txt: stated on April 19, 2010 in comments on the MSNBC show Countdown :
quote_txt: The Treaty of Tripoli signed by President John Adams was "his outreach to Muslims."

description_txt: stated on May 8, 2010 in a press release.:
quote_txt: "McCollum admitted he didn't think that the subprime mortgage crisis was a big deal, telling reporters he thought that the subprime collapse had been exaggerated by the media and investors and that 'it's not the end of the world.' "

description_txt: stated on February 16, 2010 in a press release:
quote_txt: Says the EPA "outsourced the scientific basis for its greenhouse gas regulation to a scandal-plagued international organization that cannot be considered objective or trustworthy."

description_txt: stated on May 10, 2010 in a press release:

description_txt: stated on May 9, 2010 in an interview on ABC's This Week:
quote_txt: Says federal law enforcement officers cut off questioning of the Christmas Day underwear bomber by giving him a Miranda warning after 30 minutes of questioning.

description_txt: stated on April 30, 2010 in a press release:
quote_txt: Says Gov. Rick Perry failed "to involve border sheriffs in developing plans to prevent violence in their communities."

description_txt: stated on April 6, 2010 in a press release:
quote_txt: “The percent of students who enter high school and eventually earn a diploma or equivalent, or who remain in pursuit of a diploma or equivalent, is 90 percent.”

description_txt: stated on May 2, 2010 in a television ad:
quote_txt: Says he cut 'tax rates five times'

description_txt: stated on April 27, 2010 in in a web video.:
quote_txt: "In the last 50 years, (the federal government has) only balanced the budget five times."

description_txt: stated on May 5, 2010 in an op ed article:

description_txt: stated on May 4, 2010 in a campaign statement.:

quote_txt: Scott Maddox has run "losing campaigns for 3 of Florida's 4 available cabinet positions."

description_txt: stated on May 4, 2010 in an interview with Dylan Ratigan on MSNBC:
quote_txt: Royalties for oil and other energy sources are the "second-largest revenue source to the federal government after the IRS."

description_txt: stated on May 4, 2010 in remarks to Texas reporters:
quote_txt: "If you will go look up the definition of 'act of God,' we've used it in legal terms for a long time in this state."

description_txt: stated on April 30, 2010 in a House floor speech:
quote_txt: For the new state budget, "Floridians have sent us $3 billion less of their funding."

description_txt: stated on April 28, 2010 in an interview on the Fox Business Network:
quote_txt: "Up until two weeks ago, John McCain was a leading proponent of amnesty. Now with me challenging him, suddenly he has changed."

description_txt: stated on May 2, 2010 in an interview on NBC's 'Meet the Press' :
quote_txt: "This administration and this Congress have been systematically cutting funding to border security since the Democrats took control."

description_txt: stated on April 15, 2010 in an interview with The Texas Tribune and Newsweek:
quote_txt: Says in 2003 Texas cut "$10 billion out of the entire budget, yet we put $1.8 billion more into public education. We put $800 million more into health and human services."

description_txt: stated on May 3, 2010 in a press release.:
quote_txt: "Incoming House Speaker Dean Cannon and incoming Senate President Mike Haridopolos have said they plan to champion efforts next legislative session to allow oil rigs off Florida's coast."

description_txt: stated on April 30, 2010 in an interview on MSNBC's 'Countdown with Keith Olbermann':
quote_txt: Under the Arizona immigration law, police are required to check immigration status if someone's "lawn is overgrown" or if a dog is "barking too loudly."

quote_txt: "At the moment, energy companies spend 0.25 percent on R&D."

quote_txt: On transparency in dealing with the Republican Party of Florida's financial issues.

description_txt: stated on May 2, 2010 in an interview on ABC's 'This Week':
quote_txt: Numbers on illegal immigrants "are down in terms of apprehensions, which indicates fewer illegal crossings, but also up in terms of actual enforcement actions."

description_txt: stated on April 27, 2010 in a newspaper column:
